Entries.default:
"You know that I try not to question your methods, my lord, but... surely Governor Clario could have been of some assistance?

"How are we to repair the ship without him?"
Entries.female:
"You know that I try not to question your methods, my lady, but... surely Governor Clario could have been of some assistance?

"How are we to repair the ship without him?"

Entries.default: "For now, we'll have to wait."
"I have good news for you, my lord. If my figures are correct, much of this beach will be underwater at high tide."
Entries.female: "I have good news for you, my lady. If my figures are correct, much of this beach will be underwater at high tide."

Entries.default: "When's the next high tide?"
"Then we're stuck?"
"You can't mean we're stuck here." He looks around the debris-littered beach.
"Aw, come on. We can't really be stuck here."
"You have your heading, my lord?"

"Maybe for you, but I gotta carry her onboard."

He indicates the Steward.
"And if not?"
"Oh, a week from now, I should think. Not terribly convenient, I know. We'll all have to cultivate a little patience."
"Neketaka."
"We'll see where the wind takes us."
"Not yet."
"Let's remain optimistic, shall we?"
"An ancient and beautiful city, by all accounts. I believe we'll find it some distance to the north."

"With all the damage she's suffered, the Defiant won't survive long in deep waters.

She'll float, for now. But I would recommend that we seek out a shipwright as soon as possible."
"Easy enough."
"I know it's not nice to talk about a lady's weight, but this one could use some pulleys and a couple horses."
"With a little luck, that will raise the Defiant just enough to carry it clear of the sandbar."
"Well, I'm sure we'll think of something. In the meantime, I think it best if we concern ourselves with Berath's task."
"Eothas was moving inland, when last we saw him. Might I suggest following in his footprints?"
"Last time, it stranded us here."
